text.p: Information manager Cellular Technical Services Co Inc said Tuesday it was confident that it would meet expectations for its earnings and revenues this year.

"Based upon improvements in our operations and the pace of business thus far this year, we remain comfortable with our ability to meet the financial community's expectations for revenues and earnings in the first quarter and full-year 1997," it said.
Consensus among industry analysts compiled by First Call sees the company reporting a first-quarter profit of $0.21 a share and a profit of $0.77 a share for the entire year.

Earlier in the day, Cellular Technical reported a net loss for the fourth quarter of $0.13 a share against a net profit of $0.02 a year ago. Those figures compared with a First Call forecast of a $0.11-per-share loss.
The company provides real-time information management systems for the wireless communications industry.
